IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: MCPHERSON COLLEGE IS A PRIVATE FOUR YEAR PRIVATE INSTITUTION DEDICATED TO ITS MISSION: TO DEVELOP WHOLE PERSONS THROUGH SCHOLARSHIP, PARTICIPATION, AND SERVICE.
IRS990.MissionDescription: TO DEVELOP WHOLE PERSONS THROUGH SCHOLARSHIP, PARTICIPATION, AND SERVICE. MCPHERSON COLLEGE IS A VIBRANT COMMUNITY OF PERSONS FROM DIVERSE FAITHS AND CULTURAL BACKGROUNDS. THE COLLEGE PROVIDES EDUCATION IN 18 UNDERGRADUATE MAJORS, SERVING APPROXIMATELY 550 STUDENTS.
IRS990.Description: MCPHERSON COLLEGE IS A PRIVATE FOUR-YEAR INSTITUTION WHICH PROVIDES EDUCATION IN 18 UNDERGRADUATE MAJORS FOR 2 DEGREES. THE COLLEGE PROVIDES APPROXIMATELY 550 STUDENTS WITH AN EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITY THAT EMPHASISES THE MISSION WHICH IS TO DEVELOP WHOLE PERSONS THROUGH SCHOLARSHIP, PARTICIPATION, AND SERVICE.

NameBusiness.BusinessNameLine1: SHANE NETHERTON Vice President for Finance

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE COLLEGE'S COLLECTIONS ARE MADE UP OF ARTIFACTS OF HISTORICAL SIGNIFICANCE, SCIENTIFIC SPECIMENS, AND ART OBJECTS THAT ARE HELD FOR EDUCATIONAL, SCIENTIFIC, AND CURATORIAL PURPOSES. EACH OF THE ITEMS IS CATALOGED, PRESERVED, AND CARED FOR, AND ACTIVITIES VERIFYING THEIR EXISTENCE AND ASSESSING THEIR CONDITION ARE PERFORMED PERIODICALLY. NO COLLECTION ITEMS WERE DEACCESSIONED FOR THE YEARS ENDED JUNE 30, 2009 AND 2008.

MCPHERSON COLLEGE MAINTAINS ARTIFACTS OF A HISTORICAL, SCIENTIFIC AND CULTURAL SIGNIFICANCE TO THE COLLEGE AND THE COMMUNITY OF MCPHERSON AS A WHOLE. OUR MISSION IS TO CREATE WHOLE PERSONS AND WE BELIEVE ENCOURAGING THE DEVELOPMENT OF APPRECIATION FOR THE THINGS OF THIS NATURE IS BEST DEMONSTRATED IN THE WAY WE OURSELVES PRESERVE AND CARE FOR THESE ARTIFACTS.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: MCPHERSON COLLEGE'S ENDOWMENT FUND IS INTENDED TO PROVIDE AN INVESTED PRINCIPAL FROM WHICH EARNINGS CAN BE DRAWN TO ENSURE INCOME FOR SCHOLARSHIPS FOR STUDENTS AND OTHER BOARD DESIGNATED SPENDING AS NEEDED TO ENHANCE THE EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCE WE STRIVE TO PROVIDE.

Scholarships & Grants: 5269094. Private Gifts: 765794. Investment Return in Excess of amount designated for current operations: 479018. Cost of Goods Sold: 221847. Other Miscellaneous Grouping Differences: 27722. Net Unrealized Gains in Investments: -1772513. Change in Split Interest: -265677. Loss in Interest Swap: -31750.
Scholarships & Grants: 5269094. Cost of Goods Sold: 221847. Other Miscellaneous Grouping Differences: 27722.

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: OUR RACIALLY NON-DISCRIMINATORY POLICY IS DISCLOSED ON OUR WEBSITE AND ON ALL APPLICATIONS FOR ADMISSION.
IRS990ScheduleE.GovtFinancialAidExplanation: MCPHERSON COLLEGE RECEIVES FEDERAL AID IN THE FORM OF PELL, SEOG, ACG, AND WORK STUDY GRANTS.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: ALL SCHOLARSHIPS & GRANTS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS ATTENDING MCPHERSON COLLEGE. THESE SCHOLARSHIPS & GRANTS ARE NON-CASH AWARDS, REQUIRING THE AWARDS TO BE USED AS A DIRECT REDUCTION IN TUITION COST.

Form990ScheduleMPartII.Identifier: Method for Determining Number of Contributors:
Form990ScheduleMPartII.Explanation: Number of Contributions was calculated using the total number of gifts.

STOCK DONATIONS ARE RECEIVED AT PEOPLE'S BANK & TRUST IN MCPHERSON, KANSAS. AFTER THE DONOR IS IDENTIFIED, THE BANK SELLS THE STOCK AND DEPOSITS THE PROCEEDS IN A SEPERATE ACCOUNT SET UP FOR THESE TRANSACTIONS LESS THEIR COMMISSION.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: BOARD OF DIRECTORS VOTES IN NEW DIRECTORS TO REPLACE EXITING ONES.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7b
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: BOARD COMMITTEE DECISIONS ARE VOTED ON BY ENTIRE BOARD FOR APPROVAL.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: A COPY OF THIS FORM 990 WAS REVIEWED BY THE VP FOR FINANCE AND THE FINANCE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS BEFORE BEING FILED.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: CONFLICTS OF INTEREST ARE REVIEWED PERIODICALLY FOR VIOLATIONS OF POLICIES.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: OFFICER AND KEY EMPLOYEE COMPENSATION DETERMINATION IS AIDED THROUGH THE USE OF COMPARATIVE DATA FROM SIMILAR SIZE ENTITIES AND INDEPENDENT DATA OBTAINED BY THE BOARD AND MANAGEMENT.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
THE AUDIT IS REVIEWED EACH YEAR WITH BOTH THE AUDIT COMMITTEE AND THE FULL BOARD OF DIRECTORS.
